feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 10:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds up to 40 mph have developed across Shelikof Strait. These winds are resuspending ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted. Ash is currently north of Akhiok,

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Eastern Interior and Alaska Range through Tuesday... A mix of rain and snow then changing to all snow for the Eastern Interior this morning. Not much accumulation expected for Fairbanks, but areas above 1000 feet could get up to 2 or 3 inches. Areas in the Alaska Range will likely get significant snow
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and blowing snow in the Brooks Range into Monday... An arctic front moving through the Brooks Range will bring snow and blowing snow. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected through Monday, along with northerly winds 15 to 30 mph which will reduce visibility. Use caution if traveling in the area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 9:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Prior rainfall and weather conditions will keep the Saint Johns River at Astor in Moderate Flood Stage. River levels are forecast to remain at to just above Moderate Flood Stage of 3.0 feet at Astor through the week.

entry.summary: ...Red Flag Warning for portions of Southeast Texas, Central and Southern Louisiana this afternoon and early evening... Dewpoints will will continue to range from the lower 50s to the lower 60s this afternoon, yielding RH values in the 25-30% range. entry.summary: ...Periods of snow returning this afternoon into Tuesday... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow.
